Posts.Content: May 28, 2009 02:13PM marcia-n wrote: Patti, It still seems unreal to me and I've had my dx since last Nov--actually found the lump in Oct.  I sometimes ask, how did this happen to me????  One minute I'm fine, healthy, happy, the next I'm a cancer patient with no hair! We WILL get through this! Marcia
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: May 3, 2009 04:34PM marcia-n wrote: Hi all, right mastectomy with TE on May 15.  status post chemo which finished in Feb and lumpectomy in March with unclear margins.  My surgeon broke her finger so I had to shop for new surgeons, finally coming together.  Dang.  Wish I had my original surgeon who I've been seeing since dx in Oct 08! I'm scared, but what else is new. Marcia
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2009 10:22AM marcia-n wrote: Hi Debbie, you posted a few days ago and i'm just now checking in.  I got my drain out yesterday, (skin, nipple sparing mx with expander on May 15) and I am still so tender I was in tears last night.  The muscle over the expander is so tender it hurts to have a shirt over it or even soft pj's.  I've been bandaged until now, so it's been covered and that felt better.  I tried a sports bra, but that was tight and uncomfortable. I wonder when this will calm down?  I haven't had a fill yet, but I've been very uncomfortable since surgery.  How are you coming along?
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: May 25, 2009 12:11PM marcia-n wrote: Hi All, I had my Right mx w/ expander on May 15.  The expander is driving me nuts, mostly at night.  Do any of you experience this?  Feels like a dinner plate was shoved in there.  I can feel the ridges and they're tender.  One side sort of juts out under my arm.  Sometimes I want to rip my bandages off.  Feels like a very tight and uncomfortable bra (I've always hated bras anyway) I still have a drain and will for another week becuase it's draining more than 30 ccs.  I don't mind the drain because I'd rather have that fluid drain out of me than under my tender skin! I had sentinal node biopsy in Nov, followed chemo and then unclear lumpectomy in March. Thanks, and I hope you all are doing better each day.  Marcia
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: May 28, 2009 11:55AM marcia-n wrote: So glad to have all of you! I NEVER thought I'd be going through this.  Maybe this is payback for thinking I'd always be the healthy one who holds the others up!  The cancer itself never bothered me one bit, it's the treatment that is so rough and archaic.  I hope by the time our kids are our age, no one will have to go through this.  I've lost my hair, some of my fingernails and now a breast (I was told from day one that it would be a simple and small lumpectomy.  THe mastectomy was a big blow).  During chemo I felt I was loosing myself.  There were some very dark days despite the support from family and friends.  Sometimes I felt I was ready to call it quits. I had my post op appt, and no surprises.  My skin sparing mx was on May 15.  Still  have a drain.  Expander still driving me nuts, but healing well. Take care! Marcia
Posts.Title: May 2009 surgery lovinmomma dkhancock1948

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2009 10:19PM marcia-n wrote: Thanks for all the help.  Sometimes it's hard to know what's normal. ccbaby, sorry you have to go through chemo with these things in place!  I finished chemo in Feb, followed by lumpectomy (unclear margins) followed by mx. Ktn, I saw my PS today and got the drain removed!  YAY!  He was noncomittal about discomfort level.  "Everyone's different", you know they all say that.  When it gets bad or before it gets bad, he tells me to take a half an ativan.  That works, just afraid of addiction--he tells me not to worry.  I ran it by my bs, who agrees it's OK to take ativan if I need to.  So ativan it is.  Just knowing I can fall back on that makes me feel like I'll get through this.  I probably wont need to take it much. lisa, thanks for letting me know your skin was also tender.  I hadn't heard that before.  Good to hear that part gets better.  I'll have my first fill next week. lynn, I've heard of a number of people having recon after rads.   I had chemo, but didn't have to do rads.  My ps said he does a lot of recon post rads.  How long will you have to wait after rads to have the exchange? Marcia
Posts.Title: Is it just me? Expander driving me nuts! marcia-n makingway

Posts.Content: marcia-n wrote: Hi,  I had a total skin sparing mx on May 15 (about 3 weeks).  My expander was placed w/ 100cc and I haven't had a fill since.  We're waiting to get the drainage down and the drain pulled.  I am aware of the expander 24/7 and it is sooo uncomfortable!  Like a suction cup on my chest wall or a plate shoved under my skin.  The skin over the edges is very tender.   This makes me weary of fills.  Most of you have pain with fills, but does the expander itself bother you?  This much discomfort doesn't seem right. Thanks for any input. Marcia Dx 10/20/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is it just me? Expander driving me nuts! marcia-n makingway

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2009 09:21PM marcia-n wrote: Hi Pam,  thanks for the advice.  I feel exactly the same.  If I'm moving around I feel better.  Night is especially difficult.    My skin over the edges of the expanders is so tender, it's uncomfortable to have anything touching it.  Maybe it's where the nerves have been messed with.  I just discovered something that helps.  I have a cup insert that goes in camisoles and I taped it over my mx.  It keeps the tender area from being touched and is REALLY  helping!  I'd much rather do this than ativan!  I hope this continues to help.  Last night I was in tears it was so uncomfortable.  I'm an RN, too and have been amazed about how complicated this dx is.  Everyone seems to have such different tx's, sx's.  Even the same dx and with the same oncologist sometimes yeild a different tx approach.  Very confusing at times.  Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Is it just me? Expander driving me nuts! marcia-n makingway

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2009 07:34PM marcia-n wrote: Hi vicki, Thank you for sharing your experience.  It helps so much to hear that others have had a similar experience and got throught it.  Once the drain was out, the heaviness got much better (no longer sucking the expander to my chest wall!), but now the sensitivity on the skin over the area where the drain was and over the expander edges is so raw, I can barely stand to have anything touch it.  Even my cotton pj's.  It must be where the nerves are trying to settle down.  I was considering neurontin.  Am also concerned about too many meds, weaning, etc.  I'm no longer taking ativan for muscle relaxation because this seems to be nerve pain.  I don't even want to try ativan, as I carefully weaned myself off that and don't want to do it again and I can't do narcotics as they upset my stomach, ibuprofin doesn't touch it.   What helps a bit is taping a cami or bra insert over the mx to form a tent over the sensitive area so nothing touches it.  Gads,  the things we go through!  Thank you for your thoughts on all this!
Posts.Title: Is it just me? Expander driving me nuts! marcia-n makingway
